content.question: Assume that the price of orange juice increases by 40 percent following a crop failure. If the quantity demanded falls by 10 percent, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The demand for orange juice is elastic.
The price of grapefruit juice, a substitute good, will fall.
The absolute value of the price elasticity of demand for orange juice is 4.
The absolute value of the price elasticity of demand for orange juice is 0.25.
The absolute value of the price elasticity of demand for orange juice is 10.

content.answer: The absolute value of the price elasticity of demand for orange juice is 0.25.
